Run4YourBits

Class Obstacle

  • java.lang.Object
    • Run4YourBits.Obstacle
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Checkpoint, HighObstacle, LowObstacle, PowerUp

    public abstract class Obstacle
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable
    This class defines the behavior of the standard obstacle and defines its methods

      • Obstacle

        public Obstacle(int x,
        int y,
        java.lang.String obstacleImage)
        Constructs the obstacle using the default constructor
        Parameters:
        x - the initial x coordinate of the obstacle
        y - the initial y coordinate of the obstacle
        obstacleImage - filename of the obstacle image

      • move

        public void move(int pixPerStep)
        Moves the obstacle backwards the specified pixels to simulate that they are moving with the background
        Parameters:

      • getObstacleArray

        public static Obstacle[] getObstacleArray(int levelLength,
                          int distanceBetween,
                          int heightLowObs,
                          int heightHighObs,
                          int heightPowerUp,
                          java.lang.String lowObstacleImage,
                          java.lang.String highObstacleImage)
        Generates an array of Obstacles "randomizing" their position and type
        Parameters:
        levelLength - length of the current level
        distanceBetween - minimum distance between obstacles
        heightLowObs - y coordinate for LowObstacles
        heightHighObs - y coordinate for HighObstacles
        heightPowerUp - y coordinate for PowerUps
        lowObstacleImage - filename of the image for LowObstacles
        highObstacleImage - filename of the image for HighObstacles
        Returns:
        the array of Obstacles

      • checkCollisions

        public abstract void checkCollisions(Character character,
                   MultithreadSystem sounds,
                   java.lang.Thread soundPlayer,
                   java.lang.String hitSound,
                   Background back)
        Calls the checkCollisions method in each type of obstacle in order to check whether the obstacle has collided with the avatar and takes action
        Parameters:
        character - the avatar that collides with the obstacles
        sounds - MultithreadSystem for sounds
        soundPlayer - Thread for playing the sounds
        hitSound - String that defines the hut sound for Low and High obstacles in each character
        back - the actual background
